Not only are these emerging and reemerging parasitic diseases negatively affecting human health, but they also have the potential to affect local and global economies. Broadly speaking, the debilitating nature of parasitic diseases prevents community productivity and advancement. Neglected tropical diseases, such as those caused by parasites, have resulted in losses of millions of working days and subsequently billions of dollars in economic growth each year.
